Description: Censer; bronze; with semi-circular bowl on hexagonal conical foot; on upper part are hemispherical bosses on flattened sides and loops for chains; cover consists of rows of gables and ends in point; rectangular openings and holes; bell-shaped cap, attached to lid by chains with twisted wire loops, has pierced holes and hook ending with animal head.
Curator's comments: A censer is an object in which inscense is burned during the celebration of the Mass. Medieval censers are often architectural in form to symbolise the heavenly Jerusalem, as recommended by Theophilus in his tract on metalworking (see below). PSH 26.11.91. Bibliography: Theophilus 1961 pp.113-120.
Bibliographic references: Tonnochy 1937 / The censer in the Middle Ages (pp. 47-62)
Westermann-Angerhausen 2014 / Mittelalterliche Weihrauchfässer von 800 bis 1500 (III a 39)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2018 - 2019 8 Jun - 20 Jan, Ottawa, Canadian Museum of History, Medieval Europe 2017 11 Jul – 22 Oct, Spain, CaixaForum Zaragoza, Medieval Europe. 2017 9 Mar – 18 Jun, Spain, CaixaForum Barcelona, Medieval Europe, 2016 - 2017 19 Oct – 5 Feb, Spain, CaixaForum Madrid, Medieval Europe, 2015 - 2016 11 Dec- 10 Apr, Australia, Brisbane, Queensland Museum, Medieval Europe, power and legacy.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
